## Description {#details}

Wrapper class representing virtual and physical registers.

Should be passed by value.

Definition at line 19 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/register-h">Register.h</a>.

### asMCReg() {#a49effcc0d9e7a321043ade70145d11f6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="MCRegister llvm::Register::asMCReg () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Utility to check-convert this value to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregister">MCRegister</a>.

The caller is expected to have already validated that this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> is, indeed, physical.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::Register::virtRegIndex () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Convert a virtual register number to a 0-based index.

The first virtual register in a function will get the index 0.

### isStackSlot() {#a050c8e969ce1fa8c229b074fd07be925}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static constexpr bool llvm::Register::isStackSlot (unsigned Reg)"
  labels = {["inline", "constexpr", "static"]}>
isStackSlot - Sometimes it is useful to be able to store a non-negative frame index in a variable that normally holds a register.

<a href="#a050c8e969ce1fa8c229b074fd07be925">isStackSlot()</a> returns true if Reg is in the range used for stack slots.

FIXME: remove in favor of member.

### stackSlot2Index() {#a47caf9a25186eed2215d13171af1f3ca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static int llvm::Register::stackSlot2Index (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Reg)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Compute the frame index from a register value representing a stack slot.

### virtReg2Index() {#a4df23dddc646b6a4b36ff483063a4ff8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static unsigned llvm::Register::virtReg2Index (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Reg)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Convert a virtual register number to a 0-based index.

The first virtual register in a function will get the index 0.
